intro: Cyathocalyx hexagynus, commonly known as the six-ovary cupule plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a cup-like calyx that encloses the floral parts. The plant typically produces small, clustered flowers with five to six stamens and a single pistil. Its leaves are alternate and ovate, often with a hairy surface. Cyathocalyx hexagynus is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
